author: Rembert Browne
title: The Many Lives of H. Rap Brown
description: He sits in prison after decades of fighting for Black liberation, forgotten by the nation that never understood him, writes Rembert Browne.
content:
It seemed like a fool’s errand to send Jamil Al-Amin a letter, expecting a response. But there I was, in the summer of 2019, reading his reply, sent from the U.S. Penitentiary in Tucson, Ariz.
